pullRequest.title: Reactive routes - fix race condition in generated handlers

nodes.bodyText: This is RUNTIME_INIT, isn't the bean container started in STATIC_INIT so will always be ready?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -211,7 +212,9 @@ void addAdditionalRoutes(
             BuildProducer<RouteBuildItem> routeProducer,
             BuildProducer<FilterBuildItem> filterProducer,
             List<RequireBodyHandlerBuildItem> bodyHandlerRequired,
-            BeanArchiveIndexBuildItem beanArchive) throws IOException {
+            BeanArchiveIndexBuildItem beanArchive,
+            // Make sure the routes are produced after the CDI container is ready - we need to initialize some state in the generated RouteHandler constructors
+            BeanContainerBuildItem beanContainer) throws IOException {

nodes.bodyText: I think you also want to produce a ServiceStartBuildItem to make sure that this is ready when the HTTP port is opened.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -211,7 +212,9 @@ void addAdditionalRoutes(
             BuildProducer<RouteBuildItem> routeProducer,
             BuildProducer<FilterBuildItem> filterProducer,
             List<RequireBodyHandlerBuildItem> bodyHandlerRequired,
-            BeanArchiveIndexBuildItem beanArchive) throws IOException {
+            BeanArchiveIndexBuildItem beanArchive,
+            // Make sure the routes are produced after the CDI container is ready - we need to initialize some state in the generated RouteHandler constructors
+            BeanContainerBuildItem beanContainer) throws IOException {

commit.message:
Reactive routes - fix race condition in generated handlers

- follows up on https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/8536
